title: Augmented Reality (AR)
introduction: Augmented Reality (AR) is an interactive experience that enhances the real world with computer-generated perceptual information, sometimes across multiple sensory modalities.

sections.title: How AR Works
sections.content: AR uses computer vision, depth tracking, and mapping to understand the physical environment and overlay digital content in a way that appears to coexist with the real world.

sections.title: AR vs VR
sections.content: Unlike Virtual Reality (VR) which creates a completely artificial environment, AR enhances the real world with digital elements, allowing users to remain connected to their physical surroundings.

sections.title: Applications
sections.content: AR is used in gaming (Pok√©mon GO), education (interactive learning), retail (virtual try-ons), healthcare (surgical visualization), and maintenance (equipment repair).

sections.title: Future Trends
sections.content: Future developments include more advanced AR glasses, improved spatial computing, and deeper integration with AI and IoT devices.
